responses.rationale: Factual report of a mild outcome without explicit reassuring language.
Factual report of events and characteristics ('spread rapidly' describes background condition).
Contains explicit low-risk framing ('risk... appears low').
Contains explicit low-risk framing ('at low risk').
Factual description of host range and geographic spread.
Factual statement about expected exposure increase.
Factual report of test results and deaths.
Factual report of death and test result; 'Highly Pathogenic' is technical.
Factual report of geographic spread.
Factual report of case count.
Factual report of first case; 'highly pathogenic' is technical.
Factual report of location, scale, and trigger event.
Factual description of transmission vector.
Factual report of scale of impact.
Factual statement about a company, irrelevant to risk framing.
Quote expresses concern/vulnerability ('very easily be the next one', 'donâ€™t know how to deal with it').

Factual statement about state ranking.
Factual report of affected birds and industry size; 'extremely large' describes industry.

Author framing describes psychological state ('on edge').
Factual report of outcome (survival but blindness).
Factual description of animal behavior/symptoms.
Quote contains explicit evaluative framing ('top of the list in terms of bad guy viruses').
Factual statement about a person and their agreement.
Factual description of viral characteristics and location in body.
Factual description of viral location.
Factual description of viral capability.
Describes potential outcome ('severe disease') factually.
Describes potential outcomes ('smaller dose', 'milder symptoms') factually.
Factual report of an expert's opinion.
Contains explicit low-risk framing ('risk... is low').
Factual statement about research status.
Factual statement about an expert's opinion.
Factual report of observed spectrum of severity.
Quote states possibility of 'serious illnesses'.
Author uses evaluative language ('sobering findings').
Quote emphasizes speed/ease of change/spread ('change very quickly', 'spread very easily').
Quote emphasizes speed of change ('change very quickly').
Factual description of viral evolution mechanism.
Factual report of case locations.
Factual report of case location and scale.

Factual statement linking raw milk to other diseases.
Quote discussing media algorithms and content exposure.
Contains explicit low-risk framing ('risks... remain low').
Factual report of a specific symptom.
Lists potential symptoms, 'serious symptoms' is factual descriptor.
Contains explicit low-risk framing ('risks currently being low').
Reports psychological state of concern ('expressed concerns').
Factual report of first outbreak; 'highly pathogenic' is technical.
Author framing describes psychological state ('turning into a source of concern').
Contains explicit low-risk framing ('overall public health risk is low').
Factual statement introducing the topic.
Uses a loaded metaphor ('collateral damage').
Emphasizes speed of potential negative change ('could all change quickly').
Uses vivid verb ('suddenly') and evaluative language ('major problem').
Neutral description setting up a contrast.
Factual description of symptoms.
Factual statement about prior knowledge.
Uses vivid verb ('succumb') and implies increasing spread ('growing list').
Quote emphasizes severity ('severity', 'really hadn't seen before').
Quote expresses emotional reaction ('very sad thing').
Quote uses a technical/descriptive term.
Factual explanation of a concept.
Uses comparison ('As Covid has shown') to frame potential for rapid change.
